page.title: 16Housing 2: West Meads
page.content: The following information is based on an interview with a local estate agent, Mr Colin Light. The area contains much new housing, for example the Warren, as Eastbourne has developed westwards towards the Downs in the 1970s and 80s. These new homes are of good quality and expensive. Today there is greater demand for small houses as they are easier to run and less expensive. This is an important factor as many old people retire to Eastbourne. Many of the large, old, family houses that were built at the end of the 19th century have now been converted into flats. In Victorian times the wealthy had large families and also neaded to accomodate four or five servants. This is clearly no longer practicable and therefore older houses have been split up.
